column2: 1: From fairest creatures we desire increase,

column1: 1: From fairest creatures we desire increase,
column2: 1: That thereby beauty's rose might never die,

column1: 1: That thereby beauty's rose might never die,
column2: 1: But as the riper should by time decease,

column1: 1: But as the riper should by time decease,
column2: 1: His tender heir might bear his memory:

column1: 1: His tender heir might bear his memory:
column2: 1: But thou, contracted to thine own bright eyes,

column1: 1: But thou, contracted to thine own bright eyes,
column2: 1: Feed'st thy light's flame with self-substantial fuel,

column1: 1: Feed'st thy light's flame with self-substantial fuel,
column2: 1: Making a famine where abundance lies,

column1: 1: Making a famine where abundance lies,
column2: 1: Thyself thy foe, to thy sweet self too cruel.

column1: 1: Thyself thy foe, to thy sweet self too cruel.
column2: 1: Thou that art now the world's fresh ornament

column1: 1: Thou that art now the world's fresh ornament
column2: 1: And only herald to the gaudy spring,

column1: 1: And only herald to the gaudy spring,
column2: 1: Within thine own bud buriest thy content

column1: 1: Within thine own bud buriest thy content
column2: 1: And, tender churl, makest waste in niggarding.

column1: 1: And, tender churl, makest waste in niggarding.
column2: 1: Pity the world, or else this glutton be,

column1: 1: Pity the world, or else this glutton be,
column2: 1: To eat the world's due, by the grave and thee.
